Room Guard: Angelo Fontana and
Eugenio Merciadri, 1 to be elected.
The new administration nominated today
will be voted upon in S. Cutignio during the
meeting of December 1919.
Brother Stefano Maffei proposed
that all of those who
apply for membership to the
Tuscan League and, after being notified
via postcard that they have been accepted,
do not submit a medical certificate
at the next meeting will incur

the loss of the $1.00 paid as the first deposit
of the new applicant.
The proposal of Brother Maffei was
seconded by Brother C. Silvioni
and was approved by the entire assembly.
Having nothing else to attend to,
President Muzio Frediani
declared the meeting adjourned
at 11:15 p.m.
President Secretary
M. Simonetti

Tuesday December 16, 1919 at 8:40 p.m.
the regular general meeting commenced,
presided over by President Muzio Frediani,
who, in the absence of the secretary of
correspondence, took up the duty of reading last
meeting’s minutes, which were approved without
modification.
After having resolved [the] administrative
affairs, the vote for the new officers
of the administration of 1920 was
declared open, for which [the following] were elected:
Jacopo Sodini, 11 to 8, for Vice President.
Casimiro Pellegrini, 11 to 6, for Secretary
of Correspondence. Lorenzo Lunardini [with]
13 votes and Carlo Silvione [with] 13 votes for Administrators,
from which we then proceed to a re-vote for the tie
between Brothers Fredianelli Giuseppe
and Americo Lunardini, wherefrom [Brother]
Fredianelli was elected with 14 votes against 5;
For Health Officers, Sam Paganucci and
Aladino Piaggesi were elected, 13 and 14
votes respectively against 7. For Room Guard,
Eugenio Merciadri 11 votes against 7.
Brother Sodini, seconded by Piaggesi,
proposed to hold the meetings on Sunday
during the winter. The aforementioned proposal was
approved and the president was tasked
with asking the room manager which
Sunday we could hold the meeting.
Regarding the proposal of Brother Stefano
Maffei we discussed whether to hold a meeting
for the Ball Committee prior to the [regular] meeting.

Having nothing else to attend to,
the meeting was declared adjourned.
Secretary President
Muzio Frediani Seduta 20 gennaio----- Tuesday January 20 at 8 p.m.
the regular general meeting is held,
presided over by President S. Maffei.
Following the reading of the League’s annual
expense report, Brother S. Maffei brought
attention to an injustice done with regards to
the stipend given to the secretary of finance, to whom,
instead of 4 percent, 5 percent was given. The
decision of what to do regarding the aforementioned
issue was pushed to the next meeting.
Proposed by M. Frediani, seconded by
Sam Marsili, that if the possessors of
the tickets for the ball do not bring them back to the
next meeting, the tickets will be treated as
expenses due along with their monthly dues.
We are cancelling the remaining subsidy of
$4.00 to brother Antonio Serafini because at the
time of his of sickness he was not up
to date with [his] payments.
Brother Michele Simonetti was granted
$28.00 of assistance for 28
days of illness.
Brother Carlo Silvione, seconded by
Giuseppe Tambellini, proposed to
give a gift to the young girls that

will sell flowers at our ball. The
total cost of these gifts should
not surpass $5.00.
Proposed by Brother V. Diadati and seconded
by G. Tambellini to give a gift to
Brother Lorenzo Lunardini
for having sold the greatest number
of tickets to the ball, totalling $10.00.
Proposed by S. Pasquinelli and seconded by
Lorenzo Vigano’ to give $15.00 as
a gift for Brother V. Diodati for
having beautifully executed his job
of luminously decorating the Ballroom.
Brothers J. Sodini, Giuseppe Fredianelli, and Carlo
Silvione were chosen for the committee tasked
with the acquisition of gifts.
Lastly, the resolution to hold [the next]
three meetings on Sundays was
reconfirmed, and with the fourth
to return to the regular schedule for
meetings.
Having nothing else to discuss,
the President ordered the meeting
adjourned.
Secretary President
S. Maffei

Sunday February 22 at 3:30 p.m.
the general meeting is held in the usual
meeting room, presided over by President
Stefano Maffei. The roll call of the officers
returned the absences of Carlo Silvioni
and Lorenzo Viganò, while those of Jacopo Sodini,
S. Pasquinelli, and Giuseppe Fredianelli
were excused due to illness. Last meeting’s minutes
were approved as read.
The applications for admission
of the following applicants were presented: Ernesto
Vannucci, Nicolai Serafini, Alfredo
Vannucci and Cesare Zambellini. The first [three]
were admitted unanimously,
but for the fourth, certain observations
having been made, we followed protocol
and thus it was put to a vote,
where it was rejected with 9 votes against,
and thus he was not admitted.
The discussion on what to do
with regards to the salary collected
by the ex-secretary of finance is
rescheduled for next meeting.
The gift committee having not
fulfilled its duties, with valid excuse,
the deadline is pushed to
the next meeting.
Proposed by Michele Simonetti and
seconded unanimously that those
who submitted applications for admission
prior to this meeting, and who do not

attend the next meeting,
will have their applications rejected and
will lose the right to
reimbursement for money already paid, as
dictated by our regulations.
Funds in the cashbox today: $ Having nothing else to discuss,
the president ordered the meeting adjourned.
Secretary President
Muzio Frediani Sunday March 28, 1920 at
4:00 p.m. the regular general meeting is held
in the usual meeting room under the
presidency of Stefano Maffei. The officers absent
were Lorenzo Lunardini, Carlo Silvioni, Sam
Paganucci and Lorenzo Viganò. Last
meeting’s minutes were approved as read.
Emilio Marchetti and Renato Martinelli were
admitted as new members of the society.
The application for admission of aspirant
Sam Bevilacqua was put forth and
was accepted.
The question regarding the payment of
Secretary of Finance Santino
Pasquinelli was resolved, paying him the
remaining difference.
Proposed by M. Simonetti and seconded by
E. Bertoni to make fleur-de-lis buttons
and that these be paid for by individual members.

Accordingly, it was decided to make 20 badges
which should be worn by representatives of the League
at various functions. A committee was selected for the
aforementioned to conduct a search for
the best prices. Those appointed are Muzio
Frediani and Michele Simonetti.
A subsidy was paid to the following:
Giuseppe Fredianelli $36.00
Jacopo Sodini $31.00
Benedetto Pardini $11.00
Eugenio Bertoni, seconded by Modesto Zini,
proposed that $500.00 be taken from petty cash
and invested towards the Italian loan fund
in cash.
M. Simonetti, seconded unanimously,
proposed hosting a picnic, whereupon
a committee was formed with full discretion
to choose a location if it is available
during the month of July.
The committee consisted of:
S. Maffei
M. Simonetti
L. Lunardini
Jacopo Sodini
C. Pellegrini
The order was given to distribute amongst the members
two applications for the Communal Mortuary Fund in order
to familiarize themselves.
The President ordered the meeting adjourned.
Secretary President
Muzio Frediani Stefano Maffei

Sunday April 25, 1920 at 4 p.m.
the regular general meeting was held in the usual
room, presided over by President
Stefano Maffei. The officers absent were
Carlo Silvioni, Sam Paganucci,
Aladino Piagessi, and Lorenzo Vigano'. Last
meeting’s minutes were approved as
read.
Giuseppe Fredianelli, seconded by Jacopo
Sodini, proposed giving $35.00 to the
Italian war orphans of Padre Semeria.
The proposal was approved
unanimously. It is officially
approved to take out an
italian loan of $500.00.
Brothers E. Bertoni, M. Simonetti,
Ugo Pistelli, C. Pellegrini, and Santino
Pasquinelli presented a written proposal
requesting that aspiring members
be made to visit a physician
chosen by the League. This proposal
was rejected, leaving the current
law in effect.
The Picnic Committee is given the discretion
to reserve a field but to not
spend more than $100.00.
Proposed by Lorenzo Lunardini
and seconded by C. Pellegrini to send
5 tickets to each member, with the [total] value
of $5.00, for the evening of art at the
Mascagni Club .
(over)

Petty cash at the end of today: $1252.24
Having nothing else to attend to, the
president ended the meeting.
Secretary President
Muzio Frediani S. Maffei Thursday May 20th, 1920 at 9:00 p.m.
(...) the usual general meeting was held in the
usual locale, presided over
by President Stefano Maffei. The roll call
of the officers returned the
absences of the following: Casimiro Pellegrini,
Giuseppe Fredianelli, and Lorenzo
Vigano', the last of whom was declared
removed from his position. Last meeting’s minutes
were approved without remarks.
New Brother Samuele Bevilacqua
was added to the registry after
the formal presentation of his medical
certificate. After certain administrative tasks,
we passed to the discussion
of the next picnic, which
the committee set for the first Sunday
of August. The committee was nominated
and composed as follows:
Lorenzo Lunardini as President, Adelmo
Dati as Vice President, Muzio Frediani as
Secretary of Correspondence, C. Pellegrini as
Secretary of Finance, Americo Lucchesi as Treasurer,

Santino Pasquinelli as Head of the Preparation
Committee, Jacopo Sodini as Vice Head.
The assistants chosen were
Modesto Zini, Carlo Silvioni, Cesare
Roberti, Sam Bevilacqua, E. Merciadri,
Angelo Fontana, Virgilio
Danesi and Enrico D'Enrico.
It was decided to make the picnic
open to everyone and to a have a single
ticket to cost 25¢, with the exception of children under
10 years of age.
Having nothing else to discuss,
the president ended the meeting
Petty cash at the end of today: $ Secretary President
Muzio Frediani S. Maffei General meeting June 17, 1920.
At 8:30 [p.m.] President S. Maffei called the
meeting to order. The roll call of the officers
returned the absences of Carlo
Silvioni and Sam Paganucci. Last meeting’s minutes
were approved as read. The vote
for the new Collector was held and resulted in the
unanimous nomination of Luigi Buchignani
to replace the recently removed
Lorenzo Vigano’.
Applications for new members
were presented, those for Pietro D’Arrigo,
Cesare Paterni, and Fioravanti Zini,

which were put to a vote with resulted
in their favor.
12 days of [worth of] subsidy were
granted to brother Sam Marsili and 8 days
to Brother Lorenzo Vigano’. Brother Pietro
Baranti’s claim was rejected because when he fell ill, he
was behind on monthly payments.
It was proposed by brother Eugenio
Bertani and seconded by G. Fredianelli to
make a League banner. On July 15, 1920 at 8:30 [p.m.]
the usual general meeting was held, presided
over by President Stefano Maffei.
The roll call of the officers returned the absences
of Giuseppe Fredianelli, Sam Paganucci
and Luigi Buchignani. Last meeting’s
minutes were approved without remark.
Proposed by Carlo Silvioni and
seconded by Sodini Jacopo to appoint
a committee to create the League banner,
and that the committee [in charge] should not
spend more than $100.00. The committee
is thus composed:
Casimiro Pellegrini
De Simo Serafino
Carlo Silvioni
A. Pasquinelli, seconded by G. Tambellini,
[proposed] to open an account for the banner in order

to partially make up the amount needed
for its purchase. Immediately, of those present,,
the following [members] contributed: Stefano
Maffei $5, Giuseppe L. Tambellini $5,
Giuseppe Poli $5.00, Pietro D’Enrico $5,
Santino Gambogi $5, Pasquale Maffei
$3, Aladino Lombardi $3, Ernesto
Vannucci $2, Aladino Piaggesi $2,
Francesco Giangrandi $3, Nicolai Serafino
$3.
Regarding the picnic,
Casimiro Pellegrini, seconded by Aladino
Piagessi, proposed to accept the $35.00
from Mr. Banchieri so he can sell raffle tickets for
a piano at the field. The proposal was accepted.
Others rose to speak, always with regards to the
picnic, and from that discussion arose a real
competition of offering items for sale,
the proceeds of which would benefit the group.
Thus a list was made [of those who donated]:
Stefano Maffei, a box of cigars;
Santino Pasquinelli, a nice salami;
Santino Gambogi, 5 boxes of chewing gum;
Carlo Silvione, 1 box of candy; Giuseppe
Poli, a box of candy; Ernesto Vannucci, 10
pieces of art; Emilio Marchetti, a baby;
Aladino Piaggesi, 1/2 dozen hairnets; Sodini
and Piaggesi 5 cases of pop; Americo
Lucchesi, 1 box of De Nobili Cigars;
Lorenzo Lunardini, 1 box of cigars;

Pasquale Maffei, 1 box of Big Havana;
Serafino De Simo, 12 boxes of steak candy;
Pietro D’Arrigo, 5 Buccellati [pieces]; Francesco
Giangrandi, 1 box of candy.
Having nothing else to
discuss, the president ended the meeting
with the stern affirmation that the
cashbox held $1378.17 today.
Muzio Frediani President
Secretary

Thursday August 19, 1920 the usual
general meeting was held at the regular time
and place, presided over by President Stefano
Maffei. The roll call of the officers returned
the absences of Carlo Silvioni, Giuseppe Frediani,
Sam Paganucci, Aladino Piaggesi, and Luigi
Buchignani. Last meeting’s minutes were
approved after the following observation was
added: “Instead of giving the committee
authority to only spend $100, the
proposal should have been that
they have full discretion to spend that which
is realistically needed.” The expense report on the picnic was as follows:
$592.79 in gross profit, with $404.90 in expenses,
leaving $207.90 of net profit. There are still more
than 50 tickets to be collected. Brother Santino
Pasquinelli, seconded by Americo Lucchesi, proposed
that the proceeds be deposited into the
League’s cashox. The president expressed words of gratitude
to the committee and to all who
aided them. An observation
was made regarding the poor orchestration of
the music, but nonetheless it was approved
to pay them the fixed amount in its entirety,
that of $50.00.
Proposed by Serafino De Simo and seconded
by Jacopo Sodini to take $7.00
from the cashbox to buy

flowers for the late wife of Brother
Salvatore Bartoli.
Casimiro Pellegrini, seconded by
Lorenzo Lunardini, proposed to hold our annual
ball closer to the month of November
and to nominate the committee in charge
during the next meeting.
Muzio Frediani, seconded by
Modesto Zini, proposed to change the room
from the smaller to the larger one.
Frediani is tasked with
securing it.
Petty cash today: $1657.91
Having nothing else to discuss,
the president ended the meeting
President
Secretary
Muzio Frediani S. Maffei Thursday, September 16 1920, at 9:30 [p.m.] our
general meeting was held and presided over
by President Stefano Maffei.
With the absence of the Secretary
of Correspondence, the president
asked for opinions to be given
At the meeting’s onset to decide
Who would take (notes??) Brother Ezio Carli, after
the presentation of his medical
certificate, was admitted as a member.

During the report from the Banner Committee,
Committee Head Brother Pellegrini, said
that for both the flag and the banner we would
need to go downtown and pay between $500 and
$700. He [also] stated that he did not place
the order because the price seemed excessive,
and thus, following the proposal of Brother
Omero Lasali, seconded by Brother Zini, we
came to the conclusion to have
only the banner made with a price limit
of $300 and no more, and to hold off
on the flags for the time being.
The payment of a $11.00 subsidy for Brother
Americo Pasquinelli was discussed, and making
a philanthropic gesture he deferred the sum to
benefit those affected by the earthquake.
The president referenced the catastrophe
which occurred in Tuscany with moving words
and after having left his seat to Vice President
Jacopo Sodini, he proposed removing $100.00
from petty cash and to immediately send
the sum to Italy.
This proposal was unanimously approved
by all those present.
At this moment it was
noted that Brothers S. Maffei,
S. Pasquinelli, A. Lucchese and M.
Simonetti had already collected
the sizable sum of $300.00.
The president immediately chose a

committee for the allocation of said
sum.
In accordance with a proposal
made during the last meeting to hold
a ball during the coming month of November,
the president opened the nomination of a
Ball Committee, which was thus
composed: Jacopo Sodini as President, Emilio
Marchetti as Vice President, Modesto Zini
as Treasurer, Casimiro Pellegrini as
Secretary, S. Maffei as Chairman of
Reception, M. Simonetti as Floor Manager,
and G. Fredianelli as Chairman of Arrangement.
The assistants will be chosen during the
next meeting.
Having nothing else to attend to,
the president ended the meeting at
11:15 [p.m.].
Petty Cash: $ S. Maffei

Thursday at 8:40 [p.m.] on October 21, 1920
the usual general meeting was held, presided
over by President Stefano Maffei.
The absence of the officials was not noted because
during the next meeting there will be the nomination
of the officers.
Proposed by M. Fredianni, and seconded by
Jacopo Sodini, to extend the privilege
to all Tuscans to be allowed to participate in the
League under favorable terms
which are as follows: Admission costs only $1.00
for those who are no less than 18 and
no more than 36 years old, and this exemption
will last from the next meeting in November
until the meeting in February.
[Proposed by] Brother Casimiro Pellegrini, seconded by
Modesto Zini, to suspend, with good
reason, the proposed ball. As a result
the committee chosen for it was dissolved.
Casimiro Pellegrini declared
his resignation as the Head of the Banner
Committee, and this was accepted.
In his place Brother Emilio Marchetti
was nominated.
[Proposed by] Casimiro Pellegrini and seconded
by Modesto Zini that at the next meeting
refreshments be served in honor of the Tuscan
soldiers on military leave. The following
were nominated to the committee for said party: Maffei,
Fredianelli, and A. Pasquinelli.
Having nothing else to discuss the

President ended the meeting.
Secretary President
A. Frediani S. Maffei
November 2, 1920 at 8:00 p.m. and
at the regular place at No. 607 Webster Ave.
the usual general meeting is held, presided
over by President Stefano Maffei. Almost everybody
responded present to the officer’s roll call except
for Sam Paganucci and Luigi
Buchignani, the latter of whom was sick.
Last meeting’s minutes were approved as
read.
After having attended to administrative
affairs, Brother M. Frediani [proposed], and was seconded
by Modesto Zini, to host a masquerade ball
during the next Carnival period.
The president chose a committee
to look into the most favorable place
to hold it, consisting of Casimiro
Pellegrini, Jacopo Sodini and Americo
Lucchesi.
The applications of [the following] aspirants
were presented and accepted: Verghino
Maffei, Alberto Serafini, Giacomo Maffei,
Dante Maffei, Armando Cristofani, Adolfo
Francescani, L. Donato, Raffaele Ragghianti,
Enrico Ragghianti; Guglielmo Zambellini,
and Menichetti.

Having finished all social affairs, the
President declared the nominations for
candidates for the new management of 1924.
They are arranged as follows:
For President:
Modesto Zini
Sam Marsili
Giuseppe Tambellini S.
For Vice President
Adelmo Dati
Jacopo Sodini
Lorenzo Lunardini
For Secretary
Emilio Marchetti, by unanimous vote
For Secretary of Finance
Aladino Piaggisi, by unanimous vote
For Administrators
Stefano Maffei
Giuseppe Fredianelli
Americo Lucchesi
Lorenzo Vigano’ Americo Pasquinelli
For Health Officer
Battisturi Vincenzo
Ezio Carli
Eugenio Merciadri
For Room Guard
E. Merciadri, by unanimous vote
Then the promised refreshments were provided
to the Tuscan veterans from the
war, which elicited the greatest
enthusiasm throughout the entire evening.

Petty cash at the end of the day: $1549.76
The President declared the meeting adjourned.
President
Muzio Frediani
Sec. December 16, 1920 at 8:40 p.m. the regular
meeting was held in the meeting room, presided
over by President Stefano Maffei. Sam Paganucci
and Eugenio Merciadri were found to
be absent.
The application of the new aspirant
Gino Roberto was presented and it was accepted.
Medical subsidies were provided to Brother
Emiliio Pellegrini for $30.00, and to
Angelo Santarlassi for $10.00, but
being in arrears with their payments
to the League, a proposal was made by Giuseppe
Fredianelli, and seconded by Zini Modesto,
that the ten dollars be granted as
charity rather than as his right.
Hereafter began our discussion on what
to do regarding our ball, and it was decided that
it would be held the evening of the 27th of January next
at Montefiore Hall, after which the committee members
were nominated and they are as follows:
Stefano Maffei, President
Americo Lucchesi, Vice [President]
Emilio Marchetti, Secretary
Santino Pasquinelli, Treasurer
Lorenzo Vigano’, Chairman of
Floor Managers, and his assistants:

Ronaldo Vigano’, Casimiro Pellegrini, and
Dante Maffei
Carlo Silvioni, Chairman of Reception
Committee, and his assistants: Jacopo
Sodini, Modesto Zini, and Angelo Santarlassi.
Sam Marsili, Chairman of Arrangement
Committee, and his assistants:
Quintiglio Gino, Giometti Carlo, Giacomo
Maffei, Armando Cristafami, Vincenzo
Battisturi, Eugenio Merciadri, Ezio Carli, and
Fioravante Zini.
Brother Angelo Santarlassi, seconded
by Emilio Marchetti, proposed that
the ball be in civil attire as well as
a masquerade. This proposal was
approved unanimously.
Having finished all the social affairs,
the ballots for the administrative elections
were distributed, and the following were elected:
President Sam Marsili. Vice President
Jacopo Sodini. Administrators Americo
Pasquinelli, Americo Lucchesi, and Giuseppe
Fredianelli. Health Officers Eugenio
Merciadri and Vincenzo Battistini. The remaining
were elected unanimously: Emilio Marchetti as
Sec. of Correspondence, Aladino Piaggesi as Sec. of Finance,
Santino Pasquinelli as Treasurer, and Eugenio
Merciadri as Room Guard.
Petty cash as of today $.......
Having nothing else to attend to, the
president adjourned the meeting.
Muzio Frediani , Secretary

The evening of Thursday December 30, 1920
this extraordinary meeting was held, called together
for the sole reason of discussing affairs regarding
the next ball and it the nomination of the following:
Giovanni Pasquinelli and Mrs. Padrini
for the Italian flags.
Vito Foglia and Siguara Pardini for the
American flags.
Benedetto Pardini and Mrs. Pardrini
For the League’s banner.
Angelo Santarlasci as bearer of the banner.
Carlo Silvioni as bearer of the Italian flag.
Ugo Pistelli as bearer of the American flag.
The ticket obligatory for every member
is $1.00.
[It was decided] to give an award to whomever sells the most
tickets.
Eugenio Bertoni was nominated for
Grand Marshal of the Inauguration
Speakers: Aw. P. Bell, English.
C. Lucci, Italian.
Having nothing else to attend to, the
President ordered the meeting adjourned.
M Frediani , Sec. President

Seduta Ordinaria del 20 Gennaio 1921
General Meeting of January 20, 1921.
At 8:30 p.m. President Stefano Maffei
called the meeting to order, and after the reading
of the minutes the President put it
to the approval of the assembly and it was
approved it as it was written.
We passed to the general expense report after
all bills had been paid. There remains
a net balance of $1525.48 in the Treasurer’s cashbox.
This being the last meeting that President
Stefano Maffei [would] preside over for the year 1920,
he inducted the new administration,
and called on the new president
Sam Marsili as well as all of the new
administration, and with kind words wished them good
fortune during their tenure
for the year 1921.
Administration for the year 1921
President Sam Marsili
Vice President Jacopo Sodini
Secretary of Cor. Emilio Marchetti
Secretary of Fin. Aladino Piaggesi
Treasurer Santino Pasquinelli
Administrators Americo Pasquinelli
Americo Lucchesi
Giuseppe Fredianelli
Sanitation Officers Eugenio Merciadri
Vincenzo Battistini
Room Guard Eugenio Merciadri
Collector Carlo Silvioni

After all of this had been done, the
new president said a few words, but not
knowing what to say, did not keep it very
long, and so our old secretary
M. Frediani asked for the floor to say a few words with
regards to the League, and what the League stood for.
He recommended that everybody stay together and not
be jealous of one another, that
everybody should work [together] to grow [the League]
to be larger than it is today, and that no one should speak
badly of the Tuscan League. [He also mentioned that] when something
is approved, that it be seen through rather than
treating things as they normally are treated, by declaring
to want to do this and that and then abandoning
the cause.
Then the following new members were admitted
to participate in this League. They are
Giuseppe Bianchini, 30 years old of 1311 Seitz St.,
and Francesco Poli who also provided
his medical certificate.
We discussed the payment of an $8.00 subsidy
to Brother Olinto Pacini, who was sick for 8 days with
influenza, which is in accordance with regulations,
and of $55.00 to Brother Luigi Buchignani
who was sick for 55 days
with grief.
A proposal was made by Michele
Simonetti, and seconded by Modesto Zini,
to hold a countryside party (a picnic) during the summer and to nominate a committee
to reserve the field for the last

Sunday of July or the first
Sunday of August. The committee is thus
composed: Michele Simonetti, Santino
Pasquinelli, and Casimiro Pellegrini.
Unable to continue with the
meeting for fear of it running too late
-------------------- President Sam
Marsili declared the meeting adjourned at 10:30 p.m.
Petty cash as of today: $1553.48
Secretary President
E. Marchetti Sam Marsili Seduta Ordinaria del 17 Febbraio 1921 At 8:30 p.m President Sam Marsili
brought the meeting to order. Among the absent
officers was Americo Lucchesi, and after reading
last meeting’s minutes, they were put to a vote
and were approved as written.
Admitted as new members to
be part of this League:
Orlando Francesconi 23 years old
Bruno Maffei 25 years old
Giuseppe Gianni 30 years old
Carlo Marconi circa 38 years old
And all were admitted by a raise of hands
(continued)

It was decided to pay the brothers as [their] right:
Vincenzo Diodati $56.00 of aid
Olindo Pacini $14.00 of aid
Pietro Baranti $19.00 of aid
The Picnic Committee went to reserve the
field, and they secured it for the 19th of the upcoming June,
but given that there were only 3 available Sundays
throughout the entire summer, they also put a deposit
on another time Sunday, given the
assembly would accept that, prvided it were also the case that
the assembly would want to have two picnics.
Thus the deposit was paid, reserved for
the 19th of the upcoming June. $20.00 Deposited.
It was proposed by Casimiro Pellegrini and seconded
by Giacomo Maffei to have two picnics, one on
the 19th of June and the other on the 28th of the upcoming August, and this
was approved by the assembly.
Proposed by Stefano Maffei, and seconded
by Modesto Zini, to buy a bench
from Brother Benedetto Pardini for the society’s
use, which would cost $15.00 if the assembly
would approve it, and it was accepted.
Proposed by Michele Simonetti and seconded
by Angelo Santarlasci to bring the bench
into the room for the next meeting, and this
was approved by the assembly.
Proposed by Stefano Maffei and seconded
by Modesto Zini to throw a party
for all of the members of the League, and to have the
standard and flags hanging in the room the
evening of the party in order to make them visible
for those who had yet seen them,

and to notify the members with postcards that
they should bring all the Tuscans they know,
and this was approved by the assembly.
Proposed by Jacopo Sodini and seconded
by Michele Simonetti to hold this
party on [a] Sunday if possible
and nominate a committee to act
as it sees fit and to invite
Angelo Pascuzzi for that evening.
All of this was approved by the assembly.
The committee was composed thus:
Americo Pasquinelli
Giacomo Maffei
Paolo Malfatti
Eugenio Merciadri
Sam Marsili
Casimiro Pellegrini
Proposed by Carlo Silvioni and seconded
by Giacomo Maffei to extend
the exemption until the upcoming meeting in March,
and this was approved by the assembly.
Having nothing else to discuss,
President Sam Marsili declared the
meeting adjourned at 10:45 p.m. Petty cash: $1494.90
President
Secretary
E. Marchetti Sam Marsili

Thursday March 17th at 9:30 p.m. our general
meeting was held, presided over by our President
Sam Marsili. Roll-call of the
officers returned almost everybody present
except for Giuseppe Fredianelli and Carlo
Silvioni. Last meeting’s minutes were approved
as read.
The following were admitted as new members
of this League:
Alberto Tambellini, Ottavio Giometti,
Antonio Brigidini, Francesco Bianchini,
Nello Meconi, Pietro Lunardini, Lorenzo
Puccetti, Adriano Puccetti, Giovanni Coltelli,
Alfredo Vannucci, Adolfo Andreini,
Ettore Fontana, Giuseppe Deldebbio,
Giuseppe Pacini, Martino Pasquinelli,
Riccardo Mariani, Angelo Mungai,
Nello Colombini, Eugenio Borelli, and
Pasmiro Ponzioni. They were all approved at once.
A medical subsidy of $56.00
was granted to Brother Adelmo Dati.
Proposed by Casimiro Pellegrini and seconded
by Santino Pasquinelli that a committee
be nominated for the picnic during the
April meeting and that all of the members
be notified with postcards that they should be present
for the meeting and prepared to willingly accept any obligation,
and this was approved.
3 bottles of fresh water were sold
at auction to Ezio Carli [for] $4.50, Nicolai Serafino [for]
$5.00, and Giacomo Maffei [for] $4.75. Total $14.25.

Having nothing else to attend to,
President Sam Marsili declared the
meeting adjourned at 10:30 p.m.
Secretary President
Emilio Marchetti
Sam Marsili Thursday April 21, 1921 at 9 p.m.
the usual general meeting was held,
presided over by our President Sam
Marsili. Roll call of the
officers returned the absences of brothers
Americo Pasquinelli, Giuseppe Fredianelli,
and Carlo Silvioni. The minutes
Were approved without remarks.
Guglielmo Piccinini, 44 years of age, was
admitted as a new member of this League.
The request of Brother Castruccio
Cappellini was rejected because at
the time he became sick he
found himself behind on monthly dues.
We passed to the discussion of the next
picnic and the committee [for it] is comprised as such:
Candito Pacini, President
Donato Papi, Vice President
Armando Cristofani, Secretary
Americo Lucchesi, Treasurer
Lorenzo Vigano’, Head of the
Preparation Committee, and his assistants are
Adriano Puccetti, Lorenzo Puccetti, Gino
Roberti, Nello Meconi, and Eugenio Merciadri.
(continued)

Floor Manager, Lorenzo Lunardini, and his
assistants will be chosen during the next
meeting.
Having nothing else to attend to, the
president declared the meeting adjourned
at 10:35 p.m. Secretary President
E. Marchetti
Sam Marsili Thursday May 19, at 9:15 p.m.
the usual general meeting is held,
presided over by our
President Sam Marsili. The roll call
of the officers returned the
absences of Santino Pasquinelli,
Americo Pasquinelli, Americo Lucchesi,
and Carlo Silvioni. Last meeting’s
minutes were approved as read.
The application of the new member
Amus Olivieri to be part of this
League was presented and was approved.
Medical subsidies were granted to [the following]
brothers: Angelo Fontana $46.00
Castruccio Cappellini $17.00
Antonio Serafini
There was then a discussion
regarding duties of each member, from which
resulted the need to put the modification of
Article 21 Title 4 to a vote.
The white ball would signify the need to
modify the article and the black for those who

do not understand Article 21,
and the black would signify to keep it as
written in the regulations. The result of the vote
was as follows: Black 13. White 11.
Next the [following] assistants for the
picnic were chosen: Angelo Santarlasci,
Michele Simonetti, Modesto Zini,
Raffaele Ragghianti, Paolo Malfatti,
Giuseppe Gianni, Alfredo Martinelli,

and it was decided to give the committee full discretion.

the president declared the
meeting adjourned at 11:45 p.m.
Secretary President
E. Marchetti Sam Marsili

Thursday June 16 at 8:45 p.m.
our regular general meeting is held,
presided over by our president
Sam Marsili. The roll call of the
officers returned the absences of
Brothers Vincenzo Battistini and Carlo Silvioni.
Thus Carlo Silvioni has been
absent for four consecutive meetings,
and in accordance with our regulations,
which state that anyone who misses more than
three meetings within a span of 6 months without
justification of absence will be removed
from their post, Brother
Carlo Silvioni was removed from
his duties as Collector.
Last meeting’s minutes were
approved as read.
Subsidies were granted to Brothers
Fioravante Zini $11.00
[and] Antonio Serafini $19.00.
Proposed by Emilio Marchetti and seconded
by Aladino Piaggesi that
aspirants who had submitted an application
for admission prior to this
meeting, and who do not attend the
next meeting, will have their
applications voided and the ascribed
will lose the right to reimbursement
of money already spent, in accordance with our regulations.
President Sam Marsili opened the
nominations for a Collector, and
Brother Castruccio Cappellini was nominated

by Alfredo Martinelli, and seconded
by brother Lorenzo Vigano’, and thus he
was accepted unanimously.
Proposed by brother Stefano Maffei and
seconded by brother Lorenzo Vigano’ to admit Giovanni Pasquinelli as an
honorary member of the League,
if the assembly would accept it,
and this was approved by the entire
general assembly.
Proposed by brother Muzio Frediani and
seconded by Lorenzo Vigano’ that
a prize be given to the person
who sold the most tickets for
the ball held on January 27, 1921,
which should cost no more than $10.00 and
no less than $1.00. Castruccio Cappellini and
Muzio Frediani Michele Simonetti are nominated to
buy the prize.
Then the nomination of the committee
for the picnic on the 28th of August
was opened and is comprised as such:
Carlo Marconi, President
Castruccio Cappellini, Vice President
Santino Pasquinelli, Treasurer
Giuseppe Gianni, Secretary
Michele Simonetti, Director of Preparation Committee
Stefano Maffei, Vice Director
Ramialdo Vigano’, Floor Manager.

Sam Marsili, Americo Lucchesi

Candito Pacini, Ernesto Vannucci,
Donato Papi, Adriano Puccetti,
Eugenio Merciadri, Americo Pasquinelli,
Adelmo Dati, Alfredo Martinelli,
Amos Olivieri, Ernesto Lernioni, and
Olinto Cinelli.
Having nothing else to attend to, the
President declared the meeting adjourned.
The Secretary The President
E. Marchetti
Sam Marsili

Thursday July 21 at 9:30 p.m.
our regular general meeting was held,
presided over by our
President Sam Marsili.
The roll call of the officers returned
the absence of Secretary of
Finance Aladino Piaggesi. Last meeting’s
minutes were approved as read.
Two new applications for admission to
participate in this League were
presented: Silvio Michelucci 45 years old.
Giovanni Marsili age [not given]
[Since] there were no other proposals presented
that evening, the president declared
the meeting adjourned at 10:30 p.m.
Secretary President
E. Marchetti Sam Marsili Thursday, August 18, 1921. At 9:30 p.m.
our general meeting was held,
presided over by our President Sam
Marsili. The roll call returned the
absences of the following officers:
Administrators Americo Lucchesi and Giuseppe
Fredianelli and Vice President Jacopo
Sodini, the last of whom was found [to be]
a bit ill. Last meeting’s minutes
were approved as read.
Proposed by Brother Fioravante Zini,
and seconded by Brother Giacomo Maffei,
to give a gift at the end of the year
to Treasurer Santino Pasquinelli for having

handled the League’s money in an
admirable manner.
3 complimentary tickets to the ball were sent
by The Archimedes Court of the Forest of
America No. 329, which will host the ball on the

Secretary President
E. Marchetti Sam Marsili
Thursday September 15, 1921 at 8:45 p.m.
the usual general meeting was held,
presided over by our President
Sam Marsili. Among the absent officers
were the Vice President Jacopo Sodini
who found himself ill. The previous meeting’s
minutes were approved as read.
For the first time, Giovanni Pasquinelli
was presented as an honorary
member, which resulted in a grand
applause from the entire general assembly.
Proposed by Brother Stefano Maffei, and
seconded by Brother Modesto Zini, to hold a
ball in the future as the League has always
done in the past, and then
we will discuss in the coming meetings
when we ought to have this ball.

Proposed by brother Stefano Maffei,
and seconded by brother Abramo Marsili,
to suspend the meeting for
the evening because
John A. Fugassi wanted to say
a few words with regards to the
new elections, and this was accepted
by the entire assembly. So,
our President Sam Marsili
declared the meeting adjourned
at 9:30 p.m.. Funds in the cashbox $.
Secretary President
E. Marchetti Sam Marsili Thursday October 20, 1921 at 9:00 p.m.
we held our regular general meeting,
presided over by our President Sam
Marsili. The roll call of the officers found absent the following:
Curators Americo Lucchesi and Giuseppe Fredianelli.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved
as read.
Proposed by brother Stefano Maffei, and
seconded by brother Santino Pasquinelli,
to hold the proposed Carnevale ball,
and if possible to have it on Fat Thursday,
and this was approved.
Proposed by Brother Santino Pasquinelli,
and seconded by brother Jacopo Sodini, that
fifty percent (50/100) of the net earnings be given
to the Saint Anthony Italian orphanage of
Pittsburgh, PA.

A $12.00 subsidy was granted as
aid to Brother Alfredo Lunardi.
In conformity with a proposal
made during the month of September
to hold a dance in the future, the
President chose a committee to
investigate as to which room would be
best to hold this dance, and at the
same time to put down a deposit for
the room and fix it up for
Fat Thursday if possible. He
gave full discretion to the committee.
The committee is thus composed:
Jacopo Sodini, Stefano Maffei,
Santino Pasquinelli, Candito Pacini, and
Castruccio Cappellini.
A collection was made for the [youngster],

Sam Marsili Secretary

February 22, 1922.
Proposed by Brother Jacopo Sodini, and
seconded by brother Cartruccio Cappellini,
to make the making the proposed ball a masquerade ball.

tickets are mandatory for members.

Candito Pacini, Vice President

Santino Pasquinelli, Treasurer

Committee, for which the assistants will be

Secretary Americo Lucchesi
E. Marchetti Thursday December 15, at 9:00 p.m.
we held our regular general meeting.
In the absence of the President, the
meeting was presided over by Curator Americo Lucchesi.
The minutes was approved as read.
Emilio Pasquinelli, 23, was admitted
as a new member to be part of this League.
Medical subsidies were granted to Brothers
Aladino Piaggesi $13.00, Aladino Lombardi
$37.00, and Michele Simonetti $6.00, plus $50.00
for the operation. Castruccio Cappellini and
Stefano Maffei made up the committee to buy
a gift for Treasurer Santino Pasquinelli.
Then we chose the assistants of the
Ball Committee. Reception Committee:
Adelmo Dati, Casimiro Pellegrini, Matteo
Lunardini, Lorenzo Vigano’, Giacomo
Maffei. Floor Managers: Dante Maffei
Carlo Silvioni, and Francesco Lunardini.
Arrangement Committee: Americo Pasquinelli,
Enrico Sandroni, and Giovacchino Maffei.
Having finished all social affairs we
distributed the ballots for the administrative
elections. The following were elected:
President Carlo Marconi. Secretary of Finance
Giacomo Maffei. Curators Lorenzo Lunardini,

Jacopo Sodini, and Sam Marsili. Vice
President Castruccio Cappellini, without opposition.
Secretary of Correspondence Emilio Marchetti.
Health Officers Eugenio Merciardi and
Silvio Michelucci. Room Guard Eugenio
Merciadri. Collector Romeo Maffei.
Having nothing else to attend to, the President
declared the meeting adjourned. President
Secretary Sam Marsili
E. Marchetti Thursday January 19, 1922 at 9.00 p.m.
President Sam Marsili brought the
meeting to order, and after the previous meeting’s
minutes were read they were put to a vote and
are not approved as read because there was cause
for renewed discussion regarding
Brother Michele Simonetti’s operation,
so the issue is left to the next meeting,
and a committee was chosen to investigate
if, according to our regulations, it was just to
pay him $50.00 for expenses incurred fro
the operation. Stefano Maffei, Casimirro Pellegrini
Eugenio Bertoni, and Castruccio Cappellini [make up] the committee.
A medical subsidy of $8.00 was granted
to the ex-president Sam Marsili.
The application for admission and participation
in this League was presented for Angelo
Barducci, 34, and it was accepted.
Then we passed to the dismissal of members
who found themselves to be more than (12) months
late on monthly payments. [They are] Arturo Benedetti

Roberto Bossi, Fortunato Santoni, Carlo Chiocca, Sam Paganucci,
the last two of which will be warned
for the last time and if they do not
pay by the next meeting they will be
dismissed from the League.
Being the last meeting presided over by
President Sam Marsili, he called
the new administration for the year 1922
and with wished them great success
throughout their term.
The roll call for the officials for the year
of 1922 returned the absences of brothers
Silvio Michelucci and Romeo Maffei.
Michelle Simonetti proposed, seconded by
brother Lorenzo Vigano’, that the
admission exemption be opened and made free for ages
18 to 25 with the presentation a medical certificate
of good health and advanced payment of
three months [of dues], as well as other fees if
come up. This exemption will last for the
duration of three months, which is until the April meeting.
A large discussion regarding the
mortuary fund and the deceased Brother
Alberto Lucchesi, who found himself 9 months
behind on monthly payments with the League. In the end
it was decided to pay the sum of $100.00
as written in our regulations, those of the common
mortuary fund.
Having nothing else to attend to tonight,
President Carlo Marconi declared
the meeting adjourned at 11:20 p.m.
Secretary President
E. Marchetti Carlo Marconi

Thursday February 16, 1922 at 9.00 p.m.
we held our usual meeting,
presided over by our President Carlo
Marconi. The roll call for the officers
returned the absences of Lorenzo
Lunardini and Silvio Michelucci. The previous
meeting’s minutes were approved as read.
The committee investigating with regards
the the operation gathered the night of
February 9, 1922 and they declare that no
member has the right to more than the yearly
allotted amount of $56.00, equal to
eight (8) weeks, including any
operation which the member may
encounter. This was put to a secret ballot and
was approved with 27 white balls [in favor]
and 3 black against.
Then the present of our treasurer
Santino Pasquinelli was presented,
with a value of $10.00,
and in a few words thanked the League for its
recognition of him.
Then a written proposal was presented,
signed by 5 members, who are Muzio Frediani,
Castruccio Cappellini, Emilio Marchetti,
Stefano Maffei, Modesto Zini,
which proposed to choose a committee for the
verification and correction of current regulations
and this is approved by the entire
general assembly. A committee was chosen and
is thus composed: Muzio Frediani,
Castruccio Cappellini, Stefano Maffei, Modesto
Zini, Michele Simonetti, Giuseppe
(continued)

Fredianelli, Jacopo Sodini, and Santino
Pasquinelli.
Then a committee tasked with
reserving the field for our picnic
in the future was chosen,
composed of Michele Simonetti and
Santino Pasquinelli.
A collection was made for the [youngster]
who operates the elevator and $5.00 was
collected.
Having nothing else to attend to tonight,
the President declared the meeting
adjourned at 10:30 p.m.. Petty cash
today $ Secretary President
Emilio Marchetti Carlo Marconi Thursday March 16, 1922 at 9 p.m
our usual regular general meeting is held,
presided over by our President
Carlo Marconi. The roll call
of the officers returned the absences
of brothers Lorenzo Lunardini, Romeo
Maffei, and Silvio Michelucci. Thus
Silvio Michelucci has been absent for
three consecutive meetings, and in
accordance with our regulations which state
that whoever misses three meetings within a period
of six (6) months, without justification of their absence,
will be removed from their post, Brother
Silvio Michelucci was removed from
his duty as Sanitary Officer.

The previous meeting’s minutes were approved
as read.
A medical subsidy of $15.0 was given
to Brother Sam Marsili.
The application of Ernesto Vigano’, 18,
for admission and participation in this League
was presented, accompanied with his medical
certificate, and he was admitted.
Proposed by Brother Giuseppe Tambellini, and
seconded by Brother Muzio Frediani, to
remove $25.00 from petty cash and
send it to the committee for veterans with
tuberculosis (war medicine???), provided the committee sent out a
newsletter like they had promised.
This was approved by the entire
general assembly.
The President opened the nomination
for Health Officer and Brother
Luigi Buchignani was nominated for the
post.
The Picnic Committee went to secure the field
and they reserved it for two Sundays,
which were the only available Sundays
throughout the entire summer. They reserved it for May 21
and September 3 and they paid a $20.00
deposit for each Sunday, with the
remainder due the day of the picnic.
Having finished all of the social affairs,
the President opened the nominations for
the Picnic Committee.
Americo Lucchesi President
Adelmo Dati Vice President

Modesto Zini Secretary
Muzio Frediani Treasurer
Emilio Pellegrini Chairman of Arrangement Committee
Giovacchino Maffei Vice [Chairman of] Arrangement Committee
Lorenzo Vigano’ Floor Manager
The assistants will be chosen during
the next meeting.
Having nothing else to attend to
tonight, President Carlo
Marconi declared the meeting adjourned.
Secretary President

who is dismissed from his duties,

Thursday September 21, 1922 at

Carlo Marconi. The roll call

Proposed by Casimiro Pellegrini, and seconded

of Finance, and this proposal is passed.
The committee for reviewing the books

Americo Lucchesi.

Thursday January 18, 1923 at 8.45 P.M.
the usual meeting is held,
presided over by President Carlo Marconi.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved
as read.
A medical subsidy of $11.00 was
granted to Brother Giuseppe Martinelli
for having hurt a finger.

and conceded the president’s chair to him.
President Stefano Maffei said a few
words and, thanking the entire League
for having elected him unanimously,
[said] that we ought obey that which he says
during meetings, that meetings
be held starting at 8:30 p.m. precisely,

will be present at every meeting and that
he is faithful to all Tuscans.

tonight, President Stefano
Maffei declared the meeting adjourned.

the usual regular general meeting is held,

president Stefano Maffei. The roll call

League says to pay him.

meeting’s minutes were approved as read.

refused to pay [their dues], and to

of May, or else the member will lose
their rights as outlined by our
regulations.
