Secretary President
E.J. Marchetti S. Maffei Thursday April 19, 1923 at 8.30
at night the regular general meeting is
held, presided over by
our president Stefano Maffei.
The roll call of the officers
returned the absences of the following officers:
Americo Lucchesi, Santino Pasquinelli,
and Ezio Carli. The previous meeting’s minutes
were approved as read.
Two applications for participation in
this League were presented, those of
Martino Barelli, 36, and Cesare
Deldebbio, 24. Brother
Angelo Gambogi was dismissed from
the League. The Picnic Committee reported
that under no circumstance was it
possible to host the picnic
on a Sunday.

The Banquet Committee was chosen
to investigate the best place to host
the banquet for honorary
Brother Giovanni Pasquinelli,
and to report back during meeting. The
committee is thus composed: Jacopo
Sodini, Giuseppe Fredianelli,
Benedetto Pardini, and Lorenzo
Lunardini. Proposed by Benedetto Pardini,
seconded by Jacopo Sodini, that the banquet
be for members of the League only and
no one else, and that only members should
attend. The cost of the funeral
of the deceased Brother Giovanni
Cortopassi totals $170.20,
which required that each member
pay $1.65. This amount must be
paid no later than the meeting
of July. Having nothing else to attend
to tonight, the president declared the meeting
adjourned at 10:30 p.m.
Secretary President
E.J. Marchetti S. Maffei

Thursday May 17 at 8.30
at night the usual regular meeting
is held, presided over by
our president Stefano Maffei.
The roll call of the officers
returned the absences of the following:
Candito Pacini, Giuseppe Gianni,
Modesto Zini, and Jacopo Sodini.
The previous meeting’s minutes are approved
as read.
The application for admission
and membership to this League was presented
for Giuseppe Chicci, 27, and was accepted.
A medical subsidy of $20.00 was paid
to brother Giovacchino Maffei.
Proposed by Modesto Zini and seconded by Lorenzo
Vigano’ to accept the invitation sent
by the Loggia Cittadini Italo-Americani
No. 317 Order Sons of Italy in America, and
this is approved.
The Banquet Committee reported that
they had not yet done anything, and
so it was given time until the next
meeting [to report].
The resignation of the Secretary of
Correspondence was presented, considering
that he could no longer fulfill
his duties, having little time
available, and this is approved
by the entire general assembly.
Then the nomination for Secretary
of Correspondence and a Curator were opened.

Giuseppe Gianni was nominated
for secretary and Martino Borelli
for curator.
Proposed by Giuseppe Fredianelli and seconded
by Angelo Santartasci to redistribute
the 9 months in payments paid in advance prior
the death of our late brother Alfredo
Pasquinelli, and this is approved.
Having nothing else to attend to
tonight, President Stefano Maffei
declared the meeting adjourned at 10:30 p.m.
Secretary President
E.J.Marchetti Stefano Maffei
G. Gianni
Thursday July 19, 1923 at 9 at night the
usual regular meeting is held,
presided over by our president Stefano Maffei.
The roll call of the officers returned the
absences of the following officials: Second Surator Martino
Borelli. The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as
read. The application for membership
of Giuseppe Franconi was presented and was approved.
Since the Tuscan League received 3 ticket booklets from
the Loggia S. Amato n. 248 Independent Order Sons of Italy in America,

a proposal was made by
Santino Pasquinelli and seconded by Amerigo
Lucchesi to accept 2 of the books and to reject
the other. Another proposal was made by Lorenzo
Vigano’ and seconded by Giangrandi Francesco
to accept all three. Yet another proposal [was made]
by Castruccio Cappellini and seconded by
Amerigo Lucchesi to reject them all.
After a long discussion, Cappellini’s proposal
was put to a vote. The result was
a negative, with 7 votes in favor and 9 against.
Thus it was approved to keep all of them
and to send them the sum of $15.
Proposed by Casimiro Pellegrini and seconded
by Virgilio Danesi to grant $2.50 to
the Ball Committee of January 24, last month. But,
having discovered that someone in the committee had not
fulfilled their duties, the assembly decided
that those who did work be identified and be
permitted to attend the banquet.
The committee of curators was called to see if they
had gone over the books for this semester, and they responded
that they had not done so. Having nothing else to attend to
that night the president declared the meeting
adjourned. Time 11.30 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni S. Maffei

Thursday August 16, 1923 at 9 p.m. the
usual regular meeting is opened, presided over
by our president Stefano Maffei.
The roll call of the officers returned the following
officers absent: first curator Serafino De Simo,
third curator Ezio Carli, sanitary officer Lorenzo Vigano’,
and collector Jacopo Sodini.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as read.
Castruccio Cappellini presented a petition
to remove a given sum from petty cash so that
the banquet for our honorary member Giovanni
Pasquinelli will have a greater attendance.
Another petition was presented by Amerigo Lucchesi
to not remove any sum from petty cash .
After having read the Cappellini petition,
brother Michele Simonetti asked for the floor and
voiced to the assembly that the Cappellini petition
was nice but that it was still possible to hold the banquet without
removing any money and that it will be well attended
regardless. Brother Cappellini asked for the floor and
insisted that removing a given sum
from petty cash would prompt a higher attendance at
the banquet in honor of our honorary member
Giovanni Pasquinelli more highly attended.
After a long discussion in which various members
participated, the president put the petitions
to a vote. The result of the vote was
negative for the Cappellini petition,
with 25 votes against and none in favor.
Brother Amerigo Pasquinelli asked for the floor
and announced his resignation as head of the [Banquet] Committee because
the banquet would not achieve a high enough attendance
without removing any money from the society’s petty cash.

The president them nominated Michele Simonetti as the head
of the committee for which he chose the following constituents:
Olindo Cinelli, Amerigo Lucchesi and B. Pardini.
Brother Simonetti agreed to find a
locale appropriate for hosting a nice lunch and which
did not cost more than $5.00.
In the cashbox today: $3194.20
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned. Time 10:45 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni S. Maffei Thursday September 20, 1923 at 9 p.m.
the regular meeting is opened, presided
over by our president S. Maffei.
The roll call of the officers returned the absences
of the following officers: Vice President Candito Pacini,
Health Officer Lorenzo Vigano, and Collector Jacopo
Sodini
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as read.
The application for membership of Enemia De Santi
was approved.
Proposed by Carlo Marconi and seconded by
Olindo Cinelli to add 5 more members
to the Club Committee, and the following members were
nominated: Casimiro Pellegrini, Serafino De Simo,
Olindo Cinelli, Carlo Marconi, and Benedetto Pardini Candito Pacini.
Proposed by Michele Simonetti and seconded by
Santino Pasquinelli to give the Club Committee three months

to bring something to light,
otherwise a new committee will be chosen.
Proposed by Carlo Marconi and seconded by
Ezio Carli to host two balls, the first between
November 15 and December 1, and the second on
Fat Thursday if possible. The following were tasked with
reserving the room: Santino Pasquinelli C. Marconi, C. Cappellini, and Jacopo Sodini.
The head curator Serafino De Simo reported on
the past semester and declared that the books
were in perfect order.
Proposed by Modesto Zini and seconded by
Amerigo Lucchesi to change [meeting] room, into which
the following members were chosen to investigate:
Carlo Marconi, Castruccio Cappellini, Jacopo Sodini,
Stefano Maffei, and Amerigo Lucchesi.
A subsidy of $32.00 was approved for member
Pietro Incrocci.
In the cashbox today: $3332.17. Having nothing else
to attend to, the president declared the meeting adjourned.
Time 10:45 P.M.
Secretary President
G. Gianni Candito Pacini
Thursday October 18, 1923 at 9 P.M.
the regular general meeting is brought to order, presided over
by our vice president Candito Pacini.
The roll call returned the the following officers
absent: President Stefano Maffei, First
Curator Serafino De Simo, Second Curator Ezio Carli,

Sanitary Officer Lorenzo Vigano’, for whom
this is his third consecutive absence, Sanitary Officer Modesto Zini,
and Collector Jacopo Sodini.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as read.
The nominations for the Ball Committee were opened
and the following members were chosen:
Amerigo Lucchesi President, Casimiro Pellegrini
Vice President, Giuseppe Gianni Secretary,
Candito Pacini Chairman of Arrangement,
Jacopo Sodini Assistant Chairman of Arrangement,
Carlo Marconi Chairman of Reception, and Muzio
Frediani, Castruccio Cappellini, and Michele Simonetti
as assistants.
Santino Pasquinelli Treasurer,
Lorenzo Lunardini and Modesto Zini
as supervisors.
Not having a sufficient number of members to
choose the assistants, it is decided to call an
extraordinary meeting in order to discuss what to do
with regards to the ball and in the meantime to choose
the assistants, who are [as follows]:
Martino Borelli, Giuseppe Fredianelli, Ermete Vannucci,
Pasqualino Maffei, Adolfo Francesconi, Carlo
Giometti, Adelmo Dati, Guiseppe Tambellini,
Giuseppe Martinelli, Pietro Incrocci, Nello Miconi,
Derio Chiocco, and Eugenio Merciadri.
It was proposed by Casimiro Pellegrini and seconded
by Martino Borelli that all members of the League
wear a small ribbon name tag on the night of the ball.

It was proposed by Muzio Frediani and seconded by
Carlo Marconi that all members who sell [at least]
5 tickets will have their own paid for, which
costs one dollar.
Proposed by Aladino Lombardi and seconded by
Stefano Maffei to provide a small banquet for the
Ball Committee.
A letter sent by the Sicilian Brotherhood was presented
and read, inviting the Tuscan League to
[their] ball, even including 3 complementary tickets. Brother
Muzio Frediani made a proposal, which was seconded by Stefano Maffei,
to send them ten dollars, and the
assembly agreed to send it to them.
The Secretary of Finance deposited $62.45.
In the cashbox today: $3412.57.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned at 10:45.
Secretary President
G. Gianni Stefano Maffei Thursday November 15, 1923 at 9:00 p.m.
the regular meeting is brought to order, presided over
by our president Stefano Maffei.
The roll call returned the absences of the
following officers: First Curator Serafino De Simo,
Second Curator Ezio Carli, and
Collector Jacopo Sodini.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as read.

The president asked whether the new
applicant Michele Baccelli was present and
the response was that he was not. The president then
made it known to the assembly that the new
applicant Michele Baccelli had violated
our regulations and as such forfeited
the money he had handed over
in submitting his application for admission.
After a lively discussion the assembly
declared that it was in favor of the proposal of
Casimiro Pellegrini, which was to warn him
via a letter that if he did not present
himself the night of Thursday, December 20, the day of
our meeting, he would forfeit the dollar he
had paid.
The Club Committee reported that it still
had nothing on hand to report on.
From the committee tasked with searching for a new [meeting] room,
Descalzi reported that there was nothing
better than the present room and so member
Santino Pasquinelli made the proposal, and
was seconded by Giuseppe Tambellini, to remain
where we are and it was approved.
The nomination of candidates for the year
1924 were opened and the following were nominated:
For President, Casimiro Pellegrini against
Michele Simonetti. For Vice President,
Jacopo Sodini against Abramo Marsili.
For Secretary of Correspondence, Giuseppe Gianni
is elected unanimously. For Secretary of Finance,
Modesto Zini against Emilio Pasquinelli.
For Treasurer, our old treasurer

Santino Pasquinelli [is elected] unanimously.
For Curators, Carlo Marconi, Amerigo Lucchesi,
Martino Barelli, Adelmo Dati, and Candito Pacini.
For Sanitary Officer, Giuseppe Fredianelli and
Lorenzo Vigano [are elected] unanimously. For
Room Guard, Eugenio Merciadri against Lorenzo Lunardini.
For Collector, Jacopo Sodini [is elected] unanimously.
Deposited by the secretary of finance: $21.00.
In the cashbox today: $3412.57
Having nothing else to attend to, the president
declared the meeting adjourned at 11 P.M.
The Secretary The President
G. Gianni S. Maffei
Thursday December 20, 1923 at 9 p.m.
the regular meeting is brought to order, presided over
by our president Stefano Maffei.
The roll call of the officers returned the absence of
the following officers: First Curator Serafino De Simo,
Sanitary Officer Lorenzo Vigano’, and Second
Curator Ezio Carli.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as read.
The [application of] new applicant Ezio Dini is presented
and approved. He is a native of S. Concordio Pontetetto in the Province
of Lucca.

It was proposed by Modesto Zini, and seconded by
Martino Barelli, to remove $5 from the cashbox
and to give it as a gift to the
youngster who operates the elevator.
The president put it to a vote and
it passed, but the assembly, being
dissatisfied [with the amount], made a collection and gathered
a total of $11.80.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president opened
the vote of the nominees for officers of
the year 1924.
There were thirty voters.
The president nominated Serafino De Simo,
Enemia de Santi, and Ezio Carli to collect
the ballots in a hat and to then read
the results.
The following officers were elected:
Casimiro Pellegrini as President with 19 votes.
Jacopo Sodini as Vice President with 18 votes
Emilio Pasquinelli as Secretary of Finance
with 15 votes. Carlo Marconi as First Curator
with 28 votes, Martino Borelli as Second Curator
with 16 votes, and Americo Lucchesi as Third Curator
with 14 votes. Eugenio Merciadri as Room Guard
with 17 votes. The rest of the officers were elected
unanimously.
Collected by the secretary of finance: $160.65.
In the cashbox today: $3522.55.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned.
Secretary President
G. Gianni S. Maffei

Thursday January 17, 1924 at 9 p.m.
the regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president Stefano Maffei.
The roll call of the officers returned
everybody present. After the previous meeting’s minutes were
read and approved, President Stefano Maffei called the
new officers to take their places. The roll
call of the [new] officers returned the absence of First
Curator Carlo Marconi. According to our current regulations,
brother Carlo Marconi should lose
any right [to his position], but the assembly
decided unanimously to keep Brother Carlo Marconi
in his position, given that he had to attend to
affairs outside the city. And with that, the old president
Stefano Maffei thanked the entire assembly and
left his seat to the new president Casimiro
Pellegrini, who continued the meeting.
The application of new member Diodati Ruggero, 29,
native of S. Anna in the
Province of Lucca, was accepted.
It was proposed by Lorenzo Lunardini and seconded
by Castruccio Cappellini to reschedule the second
ball for after Easter.
A medical subsidy of $20.00 was granted
to Brother Adelmo Dati.
It was approved to allow those who distinguished
themselves by selling 5 tickets apiece to be exempt from
having to pay for their obligatory ticket, and they are
the following: Candito Pacini, Sam Marsili,
Lorenzo Lunardini, Emilio Pasquinelli, and Giuseppe
Checci. A commissione composed by attorney Cianfrone and
the esteemed Mr. Ferrari was presented,

[with the intent of] sending a protest to Washington with
regards to the emigration restrictions.
The committee accepted the protest assembled by
attorney Cianfrone but retained the right to modify it.
The Curators, having gone over the annual expenses, reported
that the books were in perfect order.
The committee from the last ball gave their expense report
on the ball. Income: $414.05. Expenses: $214.25.
The remainder is a net profit of $196.80.
Deposited bhe secretary of finance: $143.50.
In the cashbox today: $3611.85.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
that
The medical certificate of sickness of Brother Santino
Gambogi was presented. Some members
noted that it was unjust to pay Santino
Gambogi his medical subsidy and so the assembly
authorized the president to choose a committee
to investigate [the matter] and to report on it next meeting.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned at 11:30 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni Carlo Marconi

Thursday February 21 at 9 p.m.
the regular meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our first curator Carlo
Marconi. The roll call of the
officers returned the absences of the following:
President Casimiro Pellegrini, Vice President
Jacopo Sodini, and Sanitary Officer Lorenzo Vigano’.
It was proposed by Muzio Frediani
and seconded by Adelmo Dati to provide a
small banquet for the Ball Committee at
Pasquinelli’s place. However all members are able
to attend if they pay in full the sum
they will be charged. It was proposed by Modesto
Zini and seconded by Adelmo Dati to grant
$2.50 to the members of the Ball Committee,
the same amount granted to the previous [ball] committee.
A medical subsidy of $19.00 was granted
to Brother Virgilio Danesi.
The payment of $51.40 was granted to
Brother Muzio Frediani for printing.
Since the president [of the committee] charged
with investigating the illness of Santino
Gambodi was absent, the assembly reschedules [the report] for next
meeting. $38.25 deposited. In the cashbox today:
$3907.90. Having nothing else to attend to, our
first curator declared the meeting adjourned at 10:30 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni C. Pellegrini

Thursday March 20, 1924 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Casimiro Pellegrini. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
First Curator Carlo Marconi and Sanitary
Officer Lorenzo Vigano’. The previous meeting’s minutes
were approved as read. Having no new
member applications, and since the
new member Ruggero Diodati did not present
himself for admission for the second time
in two months, we passed to the reading of the
correspondence, of which there was nothing. [Moving on] to
unfinished affairs, the discussion regarding
Brother Santino Giambogi is reopened, and after a lively
debate he is granted his medical subsidy of
$32.00, withholding however a week of aid,
leaving him $25.00, in accordance with
Title 50 Articles 35 and 41 of our regulations.
Proposed by Michele Simonetti and seconded by
Modesto Zini to accept the price of $4.00
for the following menu of the banquet: appetizer,
boiled beef and chicken in broth, spaghetti, roast
chicken, salad, fruit, cheese, a 1/4 [bottle of]
wine, punch, and a cigar. The League
would cover the amount of $2.50 for those members
who played a part and worked at the last ball.
Proposed by Modesto Zini and seconded
by Giuseppe Fredianelli to not host a second
ball. Moving on to new affairs, it was proposed by
Stefano Maffei and seconded by Giuseppe
Fredianelli to host a picnic during the month of

June. The Sanitary Officers reported to
the president that nobody was sick. Other
committees had nothing new [to report], nor did the curators,
as the trimester was not yet over.
Regarding bill payments, it was approved to
pay $29.00 to Brother Fioravante Zini,
$25.00 to Santino Gambogi, and
$11.25 for the cost of the room’s rent.
The secretary of finance deposited $105.90. In the
cashbox today: $3875.75. Having nothing else to attend to,
the president declared the meeting adjourned. [Time] 11:00 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni C. Pellegrini
Thursday April 19, 1924 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Casimiro Pellegrini. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
Vice President Jacopo Sodini, First Curator
Carlo Marconi, Second Curator
Martino Borelli, Health Officer
Giuseppe Fredianelli, and Health Officer Lorenzo Vigano’.
Brother Lorenzo Vigano’ having three consecutive absences,
the assembly decided, according to our
regulations, to elect a new [health officer] next
meeting. Ruggero Diodati was admitted

to be part of this society. Proposed by
Modesto Zini and seconded by Ermete Vannucci
to remove $5.00 [from the cashbox] and to send it to
the lodge of Bruno Chimirri for the invitation in which he included
5 free tickets to (his/its) large
ball and blessing of the flags.
Proposed by Santino Pasquinelli and seconded
by Enemia De Santi to pay the medical
subsidies of $14.00 to Jacopo Sodini, of $49.00
to Enrico Sandroni, and of $13.00 to
Virgilio Danesi. Deposited by the secretary of
finance: $122.00. In the cashbox
today: $3916.40. Having nothing else to attend to, the
president declared the meeting adjourned. [Time] 10:45 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni Carlo Marconi Thursday May 15, 1924 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our first
curator Carlo Marconi. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
President Casimiro Pellegrini, Vice President
Jacopo Sodini, Health Officer Lorenzo Vigano’,
and Health Officer Giuseppe Fredianelli.
Brother Lorenzo Vigano’, having been
absent for the last 4 consecutive meetings,
was removed from his post by the assembly, and

the nomination for a new [health officer] was opened. Having no
competitors, Brother Ermete Vannucci was
accepted. Having neither applications nor
admissions for new members, nor any correspondences
[to attend to], we passed to unfinished affairs, and
so the Picnic Committee was nominated,
with the following constituents: Lorenzo Lunardini,
Modesto Zini, Ermete Vannucci, Santino
Pasquinelli, and Amerigo Lucchesi.
It was proposed by Modesto Zini and seconded
by Giuseppe Gianni to make a few committees
tasked with bring in new members, which,
by increasing the [amount of] fresh energy, would
increase the spirit of the society itself.
The curators gave the expense report of the [past] trimester
and found everything to be in order.
The following bills were presented for
payment: For three month’s rent: $11.25
Insurance of the flags: $8.47
Expenditures of Ball Committee: $50.00
Frediani for printing: $21.35
In the cashbox today: $3954.90.
Deposited by the secretary of finance: $47.25
Having nothing else to attend to , the president declared
the meeting adjourned at 10:45 p.m.
Secretary C. Pellegrini
G. Gianni President

Thursday June 19, 1924 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting brought to order,
presided over by our president
Casimiro Pellegrini. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
Vice President Jacopo Sodini and Health
Officer Giuseppe Fredianelli.
The new member Aladino Frediani was
admitted unanimously. It was proposed by Stefano
Maffei and seconded by Carlo Marconi to
leave the Picnic Committee chosen as is
and to give it full discretion with regards to the organization
of the party. Our president having had the kind thought of
inviting the entire society
to his wedding, the assembly unanimously
decided to get him a gift, for which the following
members were tasked: Castruccio Cappellini
and Carlo Marconi, who were to buy the best gift
they could imagine, but which did not cost more
than $50.00. Deposited by the secretary of finance: $41.75
In the cashbox today: $3911.08.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned at 10:30 p.m.
Secretary [President]
G. Gianni Cas. Pellegrini

Thursday July 17. 1924 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Casimiro Pellegrini. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
Vice President Jacopo Sodini, First Curator
Carlo Marconi, Second Curator Martino Borelli,
Sanitary Officer Ermete Vannucci,
and Room Guard Eugenio Merciadri.
Aladino Frediani was accepted as a new
member of our brotherhood. Having not been able
to find the raffle ticket booklets that the loggia Santo
Amato had sent over, the assembly followed the
proposal of Eugenio Bertoni to
send them back. It was proposed by Eugenio
Bertoni and seconded by Modesto Zini to
send a letter to Brother Lorenzo Vigano’ [requesting] that he present himself at the next meeting
in order to respond to the accusations made against him.
Following the Bertoni and Danesi proposal the selection
of a committee thus composed was approved:
Modesto Zini, Eugenio Bertoni, Muzio Frediani,
Enemia De Santi, Olindo Cinelli, and Michele
Simonetti. The aforementioned should get together
and discuss the best manner in which to improve
the welfare of the League, in both a moral and
material sense. Following the Frediani and Cinelli proposal,
the assembly decided to print 100 raffle ticket booklets
with 5 tickets apiece, each worth 50￠,
and to give one to each member, who
will make an effort to sell them or will return them

next meeting. Being a piteous cause,
our brother Muzio Frediani
offered to do the printing for free in order
to minimize the cost for those who had
assisted our late coreligionist
Enrico Rossi. $16.30 was paid to
Mr. Frediani for printing, $40.00 to Casimiro
Pellegrini as a gift, and $41.30 for the
picnic. Deposited by the secretary of finance: $78.75.
In the cashbox today: $3952.63.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned at 10:30 p.m.
Secretary [President]
G. Gianni C. Pellegrini

Thursday August 21, 1924 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Casimiro Pellegrini. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
Vice President Jacopo Sodini, First Curator
Carlo Marconi, Third Curator Americo Lucchesi,
and Room Guard Eugenio Merciadri.
Following the proposal [of] Muzio Frediani and Lorenzo Vigano’,
it was approved to create a committee to investigate the
bills from the last picnic.
The committee’s constituents are the following:
Americo Lucchesi, Lorenzo Vigano’, and Giuseppe
Fredianelli. Since Brother Eugenio Micheli had not
fulfilled his duties as outlined in
Title IV Article 21 of our regulations,
the assembly decided to pay him for July 26
through August 5, totalling 11 days. The minutes
indicated hosting 2 picnics this year, and after a long
and lively discussion the president nominated
the following committee to organize it
for the second Sunday in September: Muzio Frediani,
Olindo Cinelli, Virgilio Danesi, Lorenzo Vigano’,
Eugenio Merciadri, Ermete Vannucci, and Adelmo
Dati. Lorenzo Vigano’ having presented himself
and admitted to having missed meetings
for the Picnic Committee and for the society itself,
the president declared the matter closed.
Proposed by Muzio Frediani, and seconded by
Giuseppe Fredianelli, to write a letter
to ex-founder Achille Guidi for his
kind thoughts in still remembering the Tuscan League

from afar. Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $44.25.
In the cashbox today: $3933.78.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned. Time 10:30 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni Chas Marconi
C. Pellegrini Thursday September 18, 1924 at 9 p.m. our
regular general meeting is brought to order, presided over
by our president Casimiro Pellegrini.
The roll call returned no absent
officers. The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as
read. Since the Order Sons of Italy in America had invited
the Tuscan League to participate in the procession on
Columbus Day, October 12th, to celebrate the most
grand and courageous navigator in the world. The Tuscan League,
not wanting to be second to anybody when in [issues] concerning the
high elevation of the Italian name, followed the proposal
of Modesto Zini, seconded by Carlo Marconi, and accepted [the invitation].
So after a lively discussion it was approved
to attend the parade in person, and further to make
a parade float, for which the following committee
was chosen: Muzio Frediani, Stefano Maffei,
E. De Santi, Ugo Pistelli, Modesto Zini,
Fioravante Zini, Batista Zini, and Candito Pacini,
who have full discretion to spend as is needed,
and [should] also to do a good job bring themselves honor.

It was proposed by Modesto Zini and seconded by
Carlo Marconi to host a ball, but no definitive date
was set. Thus the president chose the following committee
to find a location: Santino Pasquinelli, Carlo Marconi,
and Martino Borelli. Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $61.50.
In the cashbox today: $3965.53. Having nothing
else to attend to, the president declared the meeting adjourned.
Time 11 P.M.
The Secretary
G. Gianni
C. J. Pellegrini Pres.

Thursday October 16, 1924 at 8:30 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Casimiro Pellegrini. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
Secretary of Correspondence Giuseppe Gianni,
First Curator Carlo Marconi,
Second Curator Martino Borelli, and
Third Curator Amerigo Lucchesi.
It was approved unanimously to pay
the costs for which the committee for the float
had exceeded their budget, broken down as follows:
Supplies, bunting etc $32.31
Flags, straps, e ribbon $11.30
Plaster, lath, colors, etc $8.00
Lumber $8.50
Costumes $25.65
Rental of truck, space, and material $50.00
Painter’s time $25.00
Silvio’s time $24.50
Candito Pacini’s time $15.00
Gino Milani’s time $24.50
Battista Zini’s time $15.00
Candito Pacini’s time and use of machine $7.00
Use of driver and truck for banling $10.00
Superintendent’s labor execution
and use of machine for buying
supplies and directing same $50.00
Watchman $5.00
Tax bill $4.00
Total: $315.76

It was approved to dismiss the following members
for late payments: Aladino Frediani, Pietro
Incroci, Giorgio Barsotti, Americo Pardini,
Alberto Serafini, Angelo Baldacci, Eugenio
Borelli, Serafino Nicolai, Vincenzo Diodati,
and Angelo Mungai. It was decided to host the ball
the 4th of December at the Moose Temple and that it would be
open to the public, for which the following committee
was chosen: Giuseppe Tambellini di Pietro as
President, Battista Zini as Vice President,
Giuseppe Gianni as Secretary, Adelmo Dati as
Treasurer, Lorenzo Lunardini as Floor Manager,
assistant being Ettore Fontana,
Giovacchino Maffei as Chairman of Reception,
assistants being Alfredo Vannucci and Derio Chiocca,
Olindo Cinelli as Chairman of Arrangement,
assistants being Virgilio Danesi, Lorenzo Vigano’,
Eugenio Merciadri, Pasqualino Maffei,
and Alfredo Lunardi.
The following members are ill:
Giuseppe Gianni and Benedetto Pardini.
Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $170.05
Interest on money in the bank: $75.14
Total: $ 245.19
In the cashbox today: $4027.03.
The bills for the parade float totalling the sum of $315.76
were paid, as well as $22.50 for the rent for the room.
Total: $338.26. Having nothing else to attend to, the
president declared the meeting adjourned. Time 11:30 p.m.
The Secretary G. Gianni C. J. Pellegrini
Pres.

Thursday November 20, 1924 at 9:15 p.m.
our usual general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president Casimiro Pellegrini.
The roll call returned the absences of the
following officers: Vice President Jacopo Sodini,
First Curator Carlo Marconi, Third Curator
Americo Lucchesi, and Health Officer Giuseppe
Fredianelli. We opened the discussion regarding the
parade float, for which the president presented to the
assembly a bill he had received, and was held
responsible for, with regards to the accident the
parade float incurred the day of the parade,
Columbus Day October 12th, where it collided
with another car on the way to the parade, resulting
in some damages. Following a lively discussion,
the president assumed the responsibility of settling
the matter. Since the Ball Committee neglected
to fulfill its duties, the society is liable to lose
the $25.00 already paid for renting the Moose
Temple on December 2nd. (U.S.). From the report
given by the Health Officers, the members
Benedetto Pardini and Pietro Lunardini
were still sick. The following bills were approved and paid:
$3.25 to Sam Marsili for a lock for the chest
of flags, $16.00 to Giuseppe Gianni as a medical
subsidy, $22.00 to Vittorio Andreini as a medical subsidy,
$11.00 to Aladino Piaggesi as a medical subsidy,
and $1.00 to Giuseppe Gianni for security envelopes
and stamps. Total: $78.25

Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $68.75
In there cashbox today: $3933.96.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
open the nominations for officers for the
fiscal year 1925.
The following were nominated and elected
unanimously: President Michele Simonetti,
Vice President Enemia De Santi,
Secretary of Correspondence Giuseppe Gianni,
Secretary of Finance Emilio Pasquinelli,
Health Officer Giuseppe Fredianelli,
Health Officer Ermete Vannucci,
Room Guard Eugenio Merciadri.
As such only the curators remain
to be elected. The nominees are:
Candito Pacini, Lorenzo Lunardini,
Lorenzo Vigano’, Adelmo Dati,
Olinto Cinelli, and Ettore Fontana.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned. Time 11:00 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni Jacopo Sodini

Thursday December 18th, 1924 at 9:15 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our vice president Jacopo Sodini.
The roll call returned the absences of the following
officers: President Casimiro Pellegrini,
First Curator Carlo Marconi, Second Curator
Martino Borelli, Third Curator Amerigo Lucchesi,
and Health Officers Giuseppe Fredianelli and Ermete Vannucci.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as read. The assembly having
inquired if anybody had been found responsible by the president,
with regards to the damage caused by the parade float
on the day of October 12th, 1924, Columbus Day,
Brother Michele Simonetti rose and said that
the president had come to find him,
and that since he was [to be] the new president, [the president] had
yielded to him in dealing with the damaged party. The new
president Michele Simonetti and the entire assembly [agreed] that
he was charged with this task, that perhaps he would try
to not hold the League responsible for any cost of repair.
The price for renting the room for the 3 months of
January, February, and March was approved and paid for: $11.25
Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $15.75
In the cashbox today: $3924.45
Since the other officials were all elected
unanimously, the president opened
the vote for the curators. There are 6 nominees
and three positions to fill. The nominees are:

Lorenzo Lunardini, Lorenzo Vigano’, Olinto
Cinelli, Adelmo Dati, Ettore Fontana, and
Candito Pacini. There were 14 voters, and after
reading off the names the following three were
elected for the year of 1925. Olinto Cinelli and Adelmo
Dati with 11 votes each, and Lorenzo Lunardini
with 9 votes. Since Olinto Cinelli and Adelmo
Dati had the same number of votes, the president decided
in favor of Olinto Cinelli as First Curator.
Dues deposited by the Secretary of Finance for
the year 1924: $831.90
5% paid to the Secretary
of Correspondence: $41.59
4% paid to the Secretary
of Finance: $33.27
Usual yearly amount paid
to Treasurer: $9.00
Collector receives 10% of $129.65: $12.95
Having assumed their duties, the new administration
decided to provide some complimentary refreshments
to all members. Having nothing else to attend to,
the president declared the meeting adjourned. Time 10:30 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni J Sodini

Thursday January 15,1925 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our vice
president Jacopo Sodini. The roll call
returned the absences of the following
officers: President Casimiro Pellegrini,
Treasurer Santino Pasquinelli, Curators
Carlo Marconi, Amerigo Lucchesi, and Martino Borelli,
and Sanitary Officers Giuseppe Fredianelli and Ermete
Vannucci. The minutes were
approved as read. At this point, the old
administration having completed its term,
the Vice President instates the new
administration and leaves his seat to
the new president, who thanked the assembly,
asking that that they assist him in the fulfillment of
his duties, and wished for a year of
prosperity. Vincenzo Buchignani was accepted
to participate in this brotherhood. The Health
Officers reported that Brother
Antonio Serafini was ill.
[The motion] that members Paolo Malfatti,
Omero Lasali, and Ernesto Marsili should
bring their medical certificates if they want to be
readmitted to participate in this League was approved.
The following bills were approved and paid for:
Frediani for printing: $16.00
Benedetto Pardini as medical subsidy: $60.00
Pietro Lunardini for medical subsidy: $42.00
$5.00 for the youngster who operates the elevator.
Proposed by Michele Simonetti and seconded
by Stefano Maffei to host a paid banquet

with the date not yet fixed. Deposited by the
Secretary of Finance: 128.25. Total in the cashbox
today: $3837.40. Having nothing else to attend to, the president
declared the meeting adjourned. Time 11:15 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni M. Simonetti Thursday February 19, 1925 at 9 P.M.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president Michele
Simonetti. The roll call returned the
sole absence of Curator Ermete Vannucci.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as read.
Achille Lunardi, Ippolito Chiocchetti, and
Silvio Scarpellini submitted applications for
admission and were accepted. Having [brought]
with them that night the medical certificate stating that
they were in good physical health, the first two,
Achille Lunardi and Ippolito Chiocchetti, were declared
members, effective that very night. The third,
Silvio Scarpellini needs to bring his
medical certificate to the next meeting.
Ernesto Marsili was readmitted, having brought
his medical certificate. Following the proposal
of Giuseppe Tambellini and Stefano Maffei, it was approved
to host the (ball-banquet) in parallel with the exemption for

those between 18 and 35 years of age who wish
to join this League, effective the day of
March 19th and terminating the night of the ball,
which will be hosted at the Nixon Restaurant on
Sunday night. For this the following committee
was assembled: Stefano Maffei, Muzio Frediani,
Eugenio Bertoni, Santino Pasqunelli, Giuseppe Gianni, and
Lorenzo Lunardini, who, with the approval of the
assembly, opened a competition among members stating
that whoever brings in 3 new members will have their
banquet/ball paid for and will furthermore receive a gift
that the committee deems appropriate. Everybody who
is admitted during the period between March 19th and
the night of the banquet, aged between 18 and 35, will
be accepted free of charge, apart from the $2.00 [fee] for
the Communal Mortuary Fund and a clean bill of health.
Brother Antonio Serafini was paid $48.00 as
a subsidy. Deposited by Secretary
of Finance: $55.50. In the cashbox today: $3837.40.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned. Time 11:00 p.m.
Secretary G. Gianni President
M. Simonetti
Since the Ball Committee was aware of the fact, and
had informed the president, that the manager of the
Nixon Restaurant wanted [to charge] $3.50, and with
music included it would cost $4.00, the
president called an extraordinary meeting for the day
of March 8, 1925 to make a decision, [but] the
assembly accepted the fixed price of $4.00.
M. Simonetti

Thursday March 19, 1925 at 8:45 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president Michele Simonetti.
The roll call returned the absences of
the following officers: Vice President Enemia DeSanti,
Treasurer Santino Pasquinelli, First Curator
Olinto Cinelli, Third Curator Lorenzo Lunardini,
and Health Officer Ermete Vannucci.
The previous meeting’s minutes were approved as read.
In line with the qualifications of our exemption policy, the
following submitted applications for admission:
Corrado Roberti, Attilio Olivieri, Romeo Maffei,
Vincenzo Matteucci, Giuseppe Benedetti, Orlando
Francesconi, Gino Roberti, Rizieri Menchetti,
Fausto Guidotti, Vincenzo Barsotti, Ferrante Barsotti,
Giuseppe Barsotti, Giuseppe Barsotti, and Gino
Milani. Finding no objections from the assembly,
the president put them all to approval by
show of hands, and they were all accepted.
Given that the assembly was made aware that the
applicant Enrico Pardini, accepted through our exemption program,
was older than 35 years of age, he was refused exemption.
Brothers Omero Casali and Ernesto Marsili were
readmitted as members, having brought their
medical certificates as is required by our regulations
when a member travels overseas.
Following the proposal of
Serafino DeSimo, seconded by Muzio Frediani, to
nominate the administration for the banquet,
the president nominated the following members:
President Stefano Maffei, Vice President Lorenzo

Vigano’, Treasurer Santino Pasquinelli, and
Secretary Giuseppe Gianni. For the reception,
the president nominated Adelmo Dati and
Muzio Frediani. Having two proposals for the
date of the ball, the first for the first
Sunday in May, [proposed by] Maffei and Vigano’, the second
[proposed by] Fredianelli and Frediani for the second Sunday
in May, the president put them to a vote
with the latter being victorious. Proposed by Stefano
Maffei, and seconded by Lorenzo Vigano’, to
host a countryside party during the month of June.
The president nominated the following
committee for finding a location:
Lorenzo Vigano’, Stefano Maffei, and Benedetto
Pardini. The following bills were paid:
Three month’s rent for the room: $11.25
One year of insurance on the flags: $8.47
Giuseppe Gianni for stamps: $2.00
Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $82.25
In the cashbox today: $3844.90. Having nothing else
to attend to, the president declared the meeting
adjourned. Time 11:15 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni M.Simonetti

Thursday April 16, 1925 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Michele Simonetti. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
Health Officer Ermete Vannucci. Given that this
is the 3rd consecutive meeting that Brother Ermete
Vannucci has been absent, the president
nominates his brother, Alfredo Vannucci as
new Health Officer, and he accepts
the post entrusted to him. The previous meeting's minutes
were approved as read. The following submitted
applications for admittance through the exemption program:
Orlando Frosini, Enrico Allegrini, Joseph Pasquinelli,
Gilberto Baggiani, Pietro Bottari, Quinto
Pasquinelli, Lorenzo Marchetti, Quinto Marchetti,
Attilio Puccinelli, John Pasquinelli, Lorenzo
Tambellini, Nello Belluomini, Giulio Paganelli,
Modesto Marchetti, Vittorio Cortopassi, Tebaldo
Tamburi, Alberto Poli, Remo Biagi, Nando
Lucchesi, Giulio Tamburi, Ubaldo Baccelli,
Carlo Biagini, Umberto Valdissera, and Faust
Lunardini. Following the proposal of Modesto Zini,
seconded by Stefano Maffei, it was approved
send $10.00 to the Dame di Carita
from the ball given [to raise money] for orphans.
Three tickets sent by the Club Indipendente
of Bloomfield to the League in order that it be able to
represent itself at its grand ball on
April 28th were accepted. The head curator gave the
expense report of the first trimester, reporting

to have found the books to be in perfect order.
Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $114.25.
In the cashbox today: $3903.43. Having nothing else
to attend to, the president declared the meeting adjourned.
Time 11:00 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni
E. DeSanti
Thursday May 21, 1925 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Michele Simonetti. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
Third Curator Lorenzo Lunardini, Health
Officer Giuseppe Fredianelli, and Health
Officer Alfredo Vannucci. The previous meeting’s minutes
were approved as read.The following new members were
admitted through the exemption program:
Giuseppe Puccinelli, Vincenzo Marraccini,
Marello Cappellini, Casali Carlo, Ettore
Guidotti, Nat Serafini, Romeo Franchini,
Enrico De Luca, Gino Ghinacci, Olindo
Pacini, Giuseppe Sodini, Giuseppe
Tambellini, Dino Barontini, Pietro

Giorgetti, Archise Ragghianti, and Giuseppe
Francesconi. At this moment the vice president
stood up and thanked all the members
for the good outcome of the banquet,
and furthermore he explained the manner in which we could
achieve our aspirations. (Applause) Proposed by Modesto Zini and seconded by
Lorenzo Vigano’ to host the picnic the
third Sunday of the coming July. For this the following
committee was chosen: President Michele
Simonetti, Vice President Enemia De
Santi, Secretary of Correspondence Giuseppe Gianni,
Secretary of Finance Silvio Scarpellini,
Treasurer Santino Pasquinelli, Head Chairman
Lorenzo Vigano, Assistant Chairman.
Assistants: Emilio Pellegrini,
Aladino Piaggesi, Eugenio Merciadri,
Giuseppe Barsotti, Modesto Zini, and
Adelmo Dati. At this point the president
closes the meeting for three minutes of
silence [in honor of] Brother Ernesto Vigano’,
who died in April following a brief
illness. The following members are entitled to a
free banquet [for their contribution] to the exemption program:
Benedetto Pardini: 4 members
Stefano Maffei: 8 members
Americo Pasquinelli: 3 members
Giuseppe Fredianelli: 5 members
Giuseppe Gianni: 3 members
Lorenzo Lunardini: 8 members
Adelmo Dati: 5 members

Ezio Dini: 4 members
Francesco Lunardini: 4 members
Aladino Piaggesi: 4 members
Jacopo Sodini: 4 members
In addition to the banquet, the following
members are entitled to a prize as was outlined
in the exemption policy: Stefano Maffei, Giuseppe
Fredianelli, Lorenzo Lunardini, and Adelmo
Dati. The following bills were paid:
$150.00 for the funeral of Ernesto Vigano’, $10.50
for the coach to funeral, $10.00 for the flowers
at the funeral, $10.90 to the Secretary of Correspondence
for three month’s salary and $1.62 for
stamps. Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $130.00
In the cashbox today: $3952.16.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president
declared the meeting adjourned. Time 11:00 p.m.
Secretary [President]
G. Gianni M.G. Simonetti

Thursday June 18, 1925 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president Michele Simonetti.
The roll call returned the absences of the following
officers: Third Curator Lorenzo Lunardini,
Health Officer Giuseppe Fredianelli,
Health Officer Alfredo Vannucci, and
Room Guard Eugenio Merciadri. The previous
meeting's minutes were approved as read. The new applicant
Guglielmo Piccinini was admitted to
be a part of the League.
The treasurer read the final expense report of the banquet,
with the following information: Total attendance: 166.
At $3.50 a head that brings the sum to $581.00,
which was paid to the Nixon Restaurant.
$79.00 for the orchestra, $27.50 for flowers,
$8.00 for two free seats for the singer. Total
expenses: $695.50. Income: 166 people at $4.00
a head brings the sum to $664.00, which when
subtracted from $695.50 leaves a remainder of $31.50.
It was proposed by Santino Pasquinelli, and seconded
by Modesto Zini, to refund $4.00 to
Amando Fontana who was unable to
attend the banquet. The following bills were paid:
Muzio Frediani for printing: $39.65
Remainder from the banquet: $31.50
Refunds to members who had brought in
3 or more members: $44.00
In the cashbox today: $3952.16
Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $89.00
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned. Time 10:45 p.m.
The Secretary G. Gianni
Michele Simonetti

Thursday July 16, 1925 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Michele Simonetti. The roll call
returned the sole absence of Curator Lorenzo
Lunardini. The previous meeting’s minutes were approved
as read. Having had the Loggia Martire Cesare
Battisti No. 238 sent an invitation
to participate in their celebration of S. Giuseppe
in person and with flags as well as
two ticket booklets to sell,
the assembly declined both the former and the
latter, following a brief discussion. Since
the Countryside Party Committee was in need of more
personel, the president nominated the following
members, who were approved: Abramo Marsili
and Carlo Silvioni as Ballroom Guards,
Ermete Vannucci and Alfredo Vannucci to
sell the tickets for the ball, Francesco
Lunardini, Americo Pasquinelli, Giuseppe
Fredianelli, and Giovacchino Maffei to recieve
the guests, Stefano Maffei, Olinto Cinelli,
Ezio Carli, and Emilio Pasquinelli to
sell the tickets for drinks.
The following bills were paid: Michele Simonetti
for stamps: $4.00. Giuseppe Gianni
for stamps: $2.94. Giuseppe Gianni
for the trimester April-June: $10.55
Ottavio Giometti for illness: $25.00
Enrico Sandroni for illness : $60.00
Lorenzo Vigano’ was refunded $0.75 that
his nephew Ernesto Vigano had paid

in advance at the time of his death.
Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $215.75
In the cashbox today: $3926.01. Having nothing else
to attend to, the president declared the meeting
adjourned. Time 11:15 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni O. A. Cinelli Thursday August 20, 1925 at 9:30 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by the First Curator
Olinto Cinelli. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
President Michele Simonetti and Vice President
Enemia DeSanti. The previous meeting’s minutes were
approved as read. Having been unable
to prepare the expense report on the countryside party,
the treasurer declared that he would bring it
to the next meeting. Brother Ugo Pistelli
is sick. It was proposed by Modesto
Zini and seconded by Stefano Maffei to
host a banquet in the countryside the day of
Sunday October 11, 1925 to celebrate
Columbus Day. For this the following committee
was selected to find a location:
Michele Simonetti, Giuseppe Fredianelli,
Santino Pasquinelli, Stefano Maffei, and
Olinto Cinelli.

Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $71.25
In the cashbox today: $4027.27
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned. Time 11:00 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni M.G. Simonetti
Thursday September 17, 1925 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting was brought to order,
presided over by our president Michele
Simonetti. The roll call returned the
absences of the following officers: Third Curator
Lorenzo Lunardini and Health Officer Alfredo
Vannucci. Last meeting’s minutes were approved as
read. It was approved to host a banquet, with
the price of $5.00 a head, with the following menu:
Hello. Appetizer, consomme with pasta,
boiled beef and chicken, mixed fried dish,
half a roast chicken, salad, fruit and cheese,
a quarter of wine per person, and coffee.
It was also approved to leave the current committee
that had found the locale in power. The treasurer gave the expense
report of the last countryside party with the following outcome:
Income: Sandwiches and drinks: $636.00, Tickets
for entry: $189.75, Ball: $75.00, Candy: $5.00,
Woman’s bag: $1.50, Checkers for playing: $0.50.
Total Income: $907.75.
Expenses: Car: $5.00, 5 rolls of tickets for
drinks and other things: $3.00, Ice: $8.00,

Beer: $217.00, Locale: $85.00, Lost bottles: $10.00,
Car: $5.00, Stefano Maffei: $8.85,
Police officers at the field: $10.00, [Angelo] Pascuzzi: $6.00,
Enemia DeSanti: $47.63, Rama per poppa: $46.55,
Pasquinelli Bros: $28.18, Music: $50.00,
Frediani for printing: $45.80, Pacini
and Bros: $9.20, Bread: $8.80, Serafini for
Candy: $10.00, Truck: $25.00, Bambocci: $4.60,
Pittsburgh Ice Cream: $41.85, Barsotti: $5.00,
Emilio: $5.00. Total Expenses: $690.46.
Subtracting $690.46 from $907.75 leaves a
net surplus of $217.29.
Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $142.75
Interest on money at the bank: $160.90
Surplus from the countryside party: $217.29
In the cashbox today: $4098.52
Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared
the meeting adjourned. Time 11:00 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni M.G. Simonetti
Thursday October 15, 1925 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Michele Simonetti. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers:
Vice President Enemia DeSanti, First
Curator Olinto Cinelli, and Room Guard

Eugenio Merciadri. Last meeting’s minutes
were approved as read. Since the
New Loggia November 4th No. 1344 sent
25 complimentary tickets to the League to
participate in the commemoration of
the 4th of November, a historic day for all Italians.
The president makes an appeal to the assembly, who
approved accepting the invitation. The president
then distributed [the tickets] amongst the members,
requesting that they not to miss the night of
the 4th of November. Since the nominations
for the new administration are scheduled for next
meeting, it was proposed by Modesto Zini and
seconded by Giuseppe Fredianelli to
provide a small refreshment in honor of
the new nominees, paid for by the League.
The president put it to the approval [of the assembly] and
it passed unanimously. The following
bills were paid:
Three months’ rent for the room: $11.25
Frediani for printing: $12.75
Marsili for Car: $10.00
Ugo Pistelli as a subsidy: $45.00
Percentage to the Secretary of Correspondence: $15.95
G. Gianni for stamps: $3.00
Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $60.75
In the cashbox today: $4582.26.
Having nothing else to attend to, the president
declared the meeting adjourned. Time 10:45 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni M G Simonetti

Thursday November 19, 1925 at 9 p.m.
our regular general meeting is brought to order,
presided over by our president
Michele Simonetti. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers
returned no absent officers. Last meeting’s
minutes were approved as read.
Federigo Barsanti and Alfredo Tamburi
were admitted as new members. After a long discussion
regarding the Zini-Vigano’ proposal to host a
masquerade ball for Carnevale, with 25% of the proceeds
going to the orphan school ‘Artigianelli
Matteo Civitali di Lucca’, it is approved
with 21 votes in favor and 11 against [over the] the
Carli-Tambellini proposal to host a
ball without masks. Since the Zini-Vigano’ proposal
was approved, the president nominated the following Ball
Committee: President Enemia De Santi, Vice President Olinto
Cinelli, Treasurer Modesto Zini, Secretary of Correspondence
Dino Barontini, Secretary of Finance Emilio Pasquinelli,
Head of Arrangement Carlo Silvioni, with Giuseppe Tambellini
as assistant, and Adriano Puccetti,
Giuseppe Martinelli, Americo Pasquinelli, Alfredo
Vannucci, Ermete Vannucci, Ettore Guidotti,
G. Baggiani, and Eugenio Merciadri as helpers. The Reception
Committee [is thus composed]: Stefano Maffei, Adelmo Dati,
Giuseppe Fredianelli, and Giuseppe Gianni.
Heads of the Room: Lorenzo Vigano’, Lorenzo Lunardini,
and Romeo Maffei. The Health Officers reported
that the following members were sick: Fioravante
Zini, Adriano Puccetti, and Rizieri Menchetti.
As is their duty, the Curators looked over the books

of the Secretary of Finance and they found them to be in perfect
order. Deposited by the Secretary of Finance: $67.50.
In the cashbox today: $4649.76. Having no other
affairs [to attend to], the president opened the nominations for
officers for the year 1926, of which the following were nominated
unanimously: President Enemia De Santi,
Vice President Modesto Zini, Secretary of Correspondence
Giuseppe Gianni, Secretary of Finance Emilio Pasquinelli,
Treasurer Santino Pasquinelli, Health Officers Alfredo
Vannucci and Lorenzo Vigano’, and Room Guard
Eugenio Merciadri. All that is left to do is to choose
three Curators from the following six nominees: Carlo Silvioni, Giuseppe Fredianelli, Adelmo
Dati, Michele Simonetti, Olinto Cinelli, and
Americo Pasquinelli. Having nothing else to attend
to, the president declared the meeting adjourned.
Time 11:00 p.m.
The Secretary G Gianni President
MG Simonetti
Thursday December 17, 1925 at 9 p.m. our
regular general meeting is brought to order, presided over
by our president Michele Simonetti. The roll call
returned the absences of the following officers: Second
Curator Adelmo Dati, Third Curator Lorenzo Lunardini,
Health Officer Giuseppe Fredianelli, and Room Guard
Eugenio Merciadri. Last meeting’s minutes were approved as
read. The two new applicants, Alfredo Tamburi and
Federigo Barsanti, were admitted. The president of the Ball [Committee]
Enemia De Santi announced that the date of the ball had been
fixed for the night of Tuesday February 16th at the Elk Club,

and that in order for it to be a success the committee needed the
cooperation of everybody. With that, members Michele Simonetti, Carlo Silvioni,
Jacopo Sodini, Romeo Maffei, Santino Pasquinelli, Alfredo
Vannucci, and Lorenzo Lunardini all volunteered themselves to
try and sell the advertising booklets. It was proposed by
Jacopo Sodini to send a letter to those members late on payments
with their respective amounts due, and that whoever does not
settle their debt at the next meeting should be dismissed. Proposed
by Santino Pasquinelli and seconded by Abramo Marsili to give
$10.00 to the youngster who operates the elevator. Proposed by Sam Marsili
and seconded by Olinto Cinelli to provide refreshments to the new administration

The following bills were paid: $30.00 to Rizieri Menchetti as a
subsidy, $4.00 to Adriano Puccetti as a subsidy, $11.25 for
room rent, $27.90 for refreshments at Pasquinelli’s, $35.53 to the
Secretary of Finance for one year, $6.93 to the Secretary of Correspondence for three months,
$7.10 to the Collector, $9.00 to the Treasurer. Deposited by the Secretary
of Finance: $45.50. In the cashbox today: $4553.55. The president declared
the vote for the three Curators open, to be chosen from the
6 nominees. [There were] 25 Voters. The elected officers were: First Curator Giuseppe
Fredianelli with 16 votes, Second Curator Americo Pasquinelli with
12 votes, and Third Curator Olinto Cinelli with 11 votes. Eugenio Merciadri
defeated his opponent Ezio Carli for Room Guard.

Having nothing else to attend to, the president declared the
meeting adjourned. Time 11:30 p.m.
Secretary President
G. Gianni M G Simonetti
